Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the rarity and uniqueness of the flower, stating that it is the only one in the world and only blooms once every 33 years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to verify the existence of the rare flower.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photo depicts a rare flower blooming on the summit of the Papuan mountains, without providing substantial evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation that the photo actually shows a sea pen, a marine invertebrate, rather than a rare flower.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo depicts a sea pen rather than a rare flower.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing accurate and reliable information, as it has been shared with misleading claims on multiple occasions.
Understate: There is no apparent understatement bias in the claim.
